page.title: 03THE OLD MANOR HOUSE,UPWEY
page.content: {WESTBROOK HOUSE}WAS BUILT BY THE FREKE FAMILY IN THE 17TH CENTURY,BUT PARTLY DEMOLISHED IN 1730 AND REBUILT BY WILLIAM FLOYER IN 1740.THE HOUSE IS NOW IN THE HANDS OF MR.AND MRS.GEDDYS. THE HOUSE IS SITUATED ON{CHURCH} {STREET,}BUT HAS TWO ENTRANCES.ONE IS ON CHURCH STREET AND THE OTHER IS ON A SMALL TRACK TO WESTBROOK FARM.AS YOU ENTER THE GROUNDS THROUGH THE BACK ENTRANCE THE FIRST THING THAT YOU SEE IS THE CHAPEL WHICH HAS NOW BEEN CONVERTED INTO A SEPARATE HOUSE.TO THE OTHER SIDE OF THE MAIN HOUSE IS A SMALL GROUP OF STABLES WHICH ARE NOW USED AS WORKSHOPS. THE HOUSE IS BUILT OF{ASHLAR(PORTLAND} {STONE)}AS IS THE FIREPLACE IN THE DINING ROOM.AN ANNEXE ALLOWS MORE ROOMS ON THE GROUND FLOOR.
